channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Champions Liverpool geared up to lift the Premier League trophy with a 5-3 win over Chelsea.
item.title: Liverpool beat Chelsea in eight-goal thriller

item.description: The former vice president's blunt assessment came after a health-care worker expressed concern that Trump continues to blame Asians for the pandemic.
item.title: Biden says Trump is America's first 'racist' president

item.description: Tesla defied the coronavirus pandemic to post another quarter of profits, sending its stock up 6 per cent in after-hours trading and clearing a hurdle that could lead to its inclusion in the S&P 500 index.
item.title: Tesla on track to join S&P 500 after fourth-straight quarter of profits

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: Victorian face mask mandate begins as state anticipates a further spike in COVID-19 cases.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victorian face mask mandate begins as state anticipates further spike in COVID-19 cases; Australian death toll stands at 128

item.description: Investors digested mixed quarterly results and contentious stimulus negotiations in Washington.
item.title: ASX set for gains as Wall Street ends choppy session higher

item.description: Investigators were looking for evidence car giant Fiat Chrysler and truck maker Iveco sought to cheat emissions tests as the long-running "dieselgate" emissions scandal widened once again.
item.title: Fiat Chrysler and Iveco offices raided in 'dieselgate' investigation

item.description: The contract is part of what the White House calls the "Warp Speed" project, an effort to drastically shorten the time to roll out a working vaccine.
item.title: White House announces US$2 billion Pfizer contract for vaccine

item.dc:creator: Kate McClymont
item.description: The business brain allegedly behind a major crime syndicate which had defrauded the tax office of up to $17m is famous in New Zealand for all the wrong reasons.
item.title: The bankrupt, the brothel and a night in isolation

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: A trail of emails obtained by WAtoday lay bare the Seven West boss’ political connections as he sought approval to avoid hotel quarantine and self-isolate in the Kimberley upon his return from coronavirus-stricken Colorado in April.
item.title: Cleared for landing: Stokes' political clout unveiled as federal minister, Premier discuss hotel lockdown exemption

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: Documents were set on fire in the courtyard of a Chinese consulate in Texas after the Trump administration ordered the diplomatic office to shut down.
item.title: Papers set on fire after US orders closure of Chinese consulate

item.description: The findings of a new study raise provocative questions about whether the brain benefits of exercise might someday be available in a capsule form — essentially "exercise in a pill."
item.title: How exercise may change the brain for the better

item.description: The reality TV star issued a statement requesting "compassion and empathy" from the public following weeks of worrisome behaviour from her husband.
item.title: Kim Kardashian asks for compassion, says Kanye West struggles with bi-polar disorder

item.description: The number of people confirmed to be infected globally with the coronavirus has passed a staggering 15 million, with the US leading the world in cases as well as deaths.
item.title: Global coronavirus infections pass 15 million as daily new cases hit near-record level

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: Fishing trawlers are using lighting systems, equivalent to illuminating an entire football stadium, to help hoover up more than 150,000 tonnes of squid in key parts of the East China Sea.
item.title: China accused of using football stadium-style lighting to plunder fisheries

item.description: The former Wirecard managers are suspected of defrauding investors of some €3.2 billion by inflating the company's balance sheet.
item.title: Two more ex-Wirecard managers arrested, ex-CEO back in custody

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Britain has closed a secret immunity loophole that allowed the wife of an American diplomat to flee the country despite a fatal car crash.
item.title: Uproar over diplomatic immunity for alleged killer triggers rule change - with a catch

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, July 23, 2020

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Money market analysts are worried about Victoria's public finances and its AAA credit rating after public servants clinched a 3 per cent pay deal.
item.title: Public servants' pay deal will add to state's finance challenge, credit agencies warn

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: Only 4 per cent of taxes are spent on providing aged care, and a new survey finds most Australians believe more resources should be dedicated to the sector.
item.title: Australians willing to double tax to get high quality aged care

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: The imminent signing of the teen sensation should be cause for celebration in rugby circles but, as usual, things are a bit more complicated than that.
item.title: A Waratah this year: How rugby could win Suaalii against the odds

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: Like thousands of other athletes whose Olympic dreams are on hold because of the pandemic, the champion swimmer has had to sort through the mental baggage.
item.title: 'I was pretty upset and hurt': How Cate Campbell overcame her Tokyo dismay

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: COVID-19 deaths are wiping more than a decade of life expectancy from those who die from the disease, while some survivors suffer ongoing symptoms.
item.title: COVID-19 deaths wipe out an average 15 years of life, symptoms linger in young

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: The Eels star took exception to Michael Maguire's strict coaching methods, making a series of complaints on his way out of the Wests Tigers.
item.title: Raft of grievances: The real reason Matterson walked out on Tigers

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Thursday, July 23

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: A senior ANZ Bank executive has cautioned that businesses will remain hesitant about taking on debt, despite welcome efforts by the government to shore up confidence.
item.title: ANZ senior exec says businesses won't jump on debt bandwagon

item.description: The leader of alarming new climate research writes that there are lessons from the COVID response to give the planet hope.
item.title: The evidence is in: we need to flatten the carbon-emissions curve

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Beach Energy says its strong balance sheet and access to liquidity puts it in an enviable position to weather the COVID-19 storm and consider acquisitions.
item.title: Beach Energy on hunt for acquisitions as oil and gas giants divest

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Researchers have found doubling the atmosphere's carbon-dioxide levels will warm the planet about 3 degrees from pre-industrial times, narrowing the predicted range that had guided policymakers for four decades.
item.title: Sensitive planet: Scientists narrow the expected heating from CO2 rise

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: Shadow Treasurer Walt Secord has asked the NSW Parliament for assurances its IT system is not compromised amid an ASIO investigation into the office of Labor MP Shaoquett Moselmane.
item.title: Labor MP questions security of Parliament after federal raid over Chinese influence

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Thursday, July 23

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: An Australian Strategic Policy Institute report says ISPs should share information and automatically blacklist dangerous websites as Australia battles an escalation of cyber attacks.
item.title: Internet service providers urged to deliver 'clean pipes' to customers

item.dc:creator: Pru Goward
item.description: The crowding of social housing tenants into towers is a matter that requires public exposure and debate.
item.title: COVID inquiry might start with security guards, but it could stretch to crowded public housing

item.description: Clear thinking rather than 'full steam ahead' to reopen for business is what is needed now as lives come first and the economy second.
item.title: Mixed messages do not help public in fight against virus

item.description: The prosecutions of a former spy and his lawyer following Australia's bugging of Timor Leste raise critical questions about the independence of our judiciary and the functioning of our democracy.
item.title: Secret trials: our judges need to resist the government's pressure

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: Speaking on the subject of leadership, Buttrose said the make-up of the workforce had radically changed, particularly the demands of Millennials.
item.title: Buttrose says Millennial workers lack resilience and 'need hugging'

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: There's been a big change in Judith Neilson's Chippendale design team.
item.title: A departure from Neilson's masterpiece

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: Beginning the painful process of weaning our economy off JobKeeper life support remains the sensible option.
item.title: Make no mistake. This weaning process will be painful

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: The state's building commissioner fears developers may try to rush to complete apartment buildings before new laws come into force in just over five weeks.
item.title: Watchdog warns developers against forcing apartment buyers to settle

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Lockdown fatigue, cold weather, and an outbreak that is spreading through city’s most vulnerable have undermined Melbourne’s attempts to contain a deadly second wave of COVID-19.
item.title: Why our second lockdown hasn't yet flattened the coronavirus curve

item.description: Tackling gender inequality requires us to change the relationships between men and women both at work and outside work. Policies and laws that reduce gender inequality will reduce the incidence of sexual harassment.
item.title: Enlightened paternity leave scheme one pathway to gender equality

item.description: Heard has described her stay in Australia with Depp as akin to a "three-day hostage situation".
item.title: Johnny Depp threw bottles 'like grenades', former wife Amber Heard tells court

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: The government is preparing to reveal the biggest deficit and deepest recession since the 1940s in its first budget update since December.
item.title: Frydenberg to confirm nation's largest deficit and deepest recession

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: The pandemic is set to slice $21b from state economy in 2020, with the jobless rate tipped to soar past 9 per cent within two months.
item.title: Another 53,000 Victorians set to join dole queue as COVID grip tightens

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Dilvin Yasa
item.description: What does it mean to follow your heart when it leads you to an island nation far away? Three women answered the call of love and moved Down Under.
item.title: 'Beautiful, if baffling': Why these women decided to call Australia home

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Sources say Kasprowicz had questioned the leadership at CA and grown frustrated with how the board functioned.
item.title: Former pace ace Kasprowicz quits Cricket Australia board

item.description: While Dion's passengers wonder where they're bound.
item.title: Positive negatives, negative positives and COVID condiments

item.dc:creator: Madeleine Heffernan
item.description: One of Victoria's oldest and most expensive schools is shutting its Brighton campus.
item.title: Decline in enrolments forces Xavier College to close 83-year-old campus

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Areas along the central and north Queensland coasts could receive their average July rainfall in two days.
item.title: Soaking and storm for SEQ, while month's rain to fall in days up north

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Researchers list the genomes of over 5000 types of microbe that live in the human gut, about 70 per cent of which have never been studied before.
item.title: Gut feeling leads biologists to catalogue the bugs in our bellies
